content: and first row together slip_stitch both sides together and finish off leaving a nice long tail for sewing together you should now have a tube step 2 turn seam to inside step 3 tuck the short tail from the initial chain to the inside thread the tapestry needle and catch the stitches around the edge of the tube see picture to right or refer to the youtube video once you are back to the start draw the thread up to gather the tube together you will still have a hole in the centre see picture to left sew back and forwards to close this off 2 step 4 thread the needle and thread through the centre and into the inside of the pumpkin push through the seam at the open end of the pumpkin and stuff step 5 repeat step 3 step 6 push the needle and thread from the centre top through to the centre bottom then back up from a slightly different point on the centre bottom to the centre top repeat this three or four times pulling a little to cinch the pumpkin in secure the thread before pushing through into the centre of the pumpkin to hide the ends cut off the excess the stalk the quick and easy method you may need to cut the cinnamon stick or stick to a better length to represent the stalk heat a glue gun and once heated sufficiently place a small amount in the centre top of the pumpkin and push in and hold the cinnamon stick until the glue starts to set your pumpkin is finished display gift or sell and enjoy the stalk using the i-cord method this is definitely the fiddley method but it also looks good and because we don t need too long an i-cord it is worth trying out set-up using a yarn colour suitable for the stalk begin with a ch3 row 1 in the second chain from the hook pull yarn through and leave on hook then in the third last chain pull yarn through and leave on hook you will have 3sts on the hook row 2 take first 2sts off the hook and hold tight so as not to lose them yarn over hook and pull through first st place 2nd st back on hook yarn over hook and pull through place 3rd st back on hook yarn over and pull through you should again have 3sts on the hook repeat row 2 until the desired length then yarn over pull through all 3 sts cut a long tail for sewing onto pumpkin and pull through to secure st to get a thick stalk fold in half but you can just crochet enough of an i-cord for single height folding in half fold in half and sew the edges together this is demonstrated in the youtube video attaching to the pumpkin i thread the long tail in at the top of the pumpkin catching a couple of stitches
